definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: OK, so the question is about Bluetooth. I think I heard.
sentences.chinese: 好，问题时关于蓝牙吧，我好像听清了。

sentences.english: When you go into the interview, speak clearly so you can be heard.
sentences.chinese: 口试时要口齿清晰让考官和搭档能够听清你的话。

sentences.english: I'm sorry. I didn't follow you. Could you please repeat that?
sentences.chinese: 对不起。我没有听清您的话。请您再说一遍行吗？

sentences.english: Get up front where your audience can see and hear you.
sentences.chinese: 站到前面来，这样听众可以看到你，听清你所讲的。

sentences.english: We fear we can't hear him clearly as he has such a big beard.
sentences.chinese: 因为他的胡子又多又长，我们怕不能听清他说什么。

sentences.english: The Xiao even fighter didn't listen to pure, he has inside the fulfilment in the body, but is listen to pure some.
sentences.chinese: 肖平军没有听清，他有内功在身，却是听清了一些的。

sentences.english: And I could only make out one word "disappointed".
sentences.chinese: 我只勉强听清了一个词“失望”。

sentences.english: She was not sure she had heard him, and was about to repeat the question.
sentences.chinese: 她吃不准自己是否听清了他的话，正准备再问一遍。

definition: to understand (on hearing)/to catch (what is spoken)
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
to understand (by hearing)/to catch (what sb says)
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
